business.headline: India plans to cut EU car tariffs to 40% from 110% ahead of trade deal: ReportThe anticipated tariff cuts would substantially ease access to the Indian market for Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW.

IndiGo cancels flights to Tbilisi, Tashkent, Baku till Jan 28 amid Iran tensionsIn view of the prevailing situation and after careful assessment, IndiGo said it was cancelling flights to and from Tbilisi (Georgia), Almaty (Kazakhstan), Tashkent (Uzbekistan) and Baku (Azerbaijan) on January 26, 27 and 28.

India, EU mega trade deal near finish line with phased tariff cuts: Maros SefcovicAutomobiles have long been one of the toughest chapters in the India–EU free trade negotiations. European carmakers have sought lower import duties and clearer rules to expand their footprint in India, while New Delhi has remained cautious, wary of exposing domestic manufacturers to sudden competition.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

Explained: Why EU leaders' India visit matters for the mega trade dealBy linking one of the world's fastest-growing major economies with a bloc that remains a central pillar of global trade, the deal would reshape supply-chain flows at a time when governments are rethinking their economic dependencies.

IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

French President's viral Davos shades give iVision Tech a 38 crore stock boostFrench President Emmanuel Macron's look during his World Economic Forum speech went viral online and the market reacted instantly.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Is Rs 50,000 salary enough to invest? Sebi advisor explains what actually worksFinancial advisors say this income level is enough to begin building a long-term portfolio, provided the focus remains on discipline, safety and clear financial goals.

IndiGo share price down 4% after Q3 results: Buy, sell or hold?IndiGo share price: The stock slipped as much as 3.9% during early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 4,723.60. It later recovered part of the losses but continued to trade in the red.

Gold and silver hit new highs again. Should you still buy?While the domestic trend remains sharply bullish, experts say understanding the broader backdrop can help investors think about why the rally is persisting and what it could mean for portfolios this year.

entertainment.headline: Republic Day: I&B ministry, Sanjay Leela Bhansali present tableau of Indian cinema The 'Bharat Gatha: Shruti, Kriti, Drishti' tableau envisioned by Sanjay Leela Bhansali was presented at Kartavya Path on Republic Day.

Falls for girls who need a sugar daddy: Govinda's wife Ssunita says about actor In a new interview, Ssunita Ahuja addressed her husband Govinda's alleged extra-marital affairs, attributing responsibility both to aspiring actors and the veteran actor himself.

Watch: Govinda brings back 90s magic with his surprise dance at school function Actor Govinda engaged with students and parents at two schools annual day programmes in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh. Several videos from the event have gone viral.

Big B recalls Alia Bhatt was speechless after hearing Chatori Rajani's story Amitabh Bachchan and Alia Bhatt attended Sadak Suraksha Abhiyan 2026 focused on road safety. Emotional personal stories highlighted urgent need for timely aid and empathy towards accident victims.

Japanese singer Fujii Kaze on India debut, inspiration from Hindu spirituality Japanese singer Fujii Kaze speaks to India Today about spirituality, his album Prema, and India as his spiritual home. He also opens up about his Lollapalooza Mumbai debut and creative journey.

Esha Deol dismisses family discord rumours, hosts Sunny's Border 2 screening Esha Deol recently hosted the screening of Sunny Deol's latest release, 'Border 2'. Several videos and pictures from the screening have emerged online.

Disha Patani, Talwiinder attend Lollapalooza amid dating buzz. Watch video Actor Disha Patani and Punjabi singer Talwiinder were seen together at Lollapalooza 2026 in Mumbai, drawing attention after a video of the two surfaced online. The footage and their previous appearances have led to dating speculation, although neither has commented publicly.

Menopause is not that generous: Twinkle Khanna gets real about ageing at 52 Twinkle Khanna shared a refreshingly honest take on menopause and ageing in her 50s. Her social media post highlighted the challenges and practical self-care steps that empower women to navigate this phase.

Hrithik Roshan explains crutches, jokes about knee trouble and 'OFF' days Actor Hrithik Roshan has explained the reason behind his use of crutches at Goldie Behl's birthday event. He described his temporary knee trouble in a candid Instagram post that included humorous reflections on his unique physical experiences.

Inside Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli's private London puja, unseen pic goes viral A recent viral photo captured Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma with a priest after a puja ceremony at their London residence.

Margot Robbie, Jacob Elordi open up about intense bond: He's mine! Actors Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi opened up about their intense on-set chemistry while filming Wuthering Heights. They admitted it was hard shooting scenes without each other.

Border 2 fever: Sunny Deol, Ahan Shetty meet roaring fans at Gaiety Galaxy. Watch Sunny Deol and Ahan Shetty made an unexpected appearance at Gaiety Galaxy to meet the delighted fans as 'Border 2' achieved major box office success just three days after its release.

Border 2 box office day 3: Sunny Deol film races past Rs 100 crore in India Border 2 has collected over Rs 100 crore in India and Rs 150 crore worldwide within its first three days. The film stars Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty and Diljit Dosanjh in key roles.

Exclusive: Ranvir Shorey reacts to call for 8-hour workday, A R Rahman's bias claim Actor Ranvir Shorey opened up on long work hours, health, and the quality of work on sets. He also shared his thoughts on AR Rahman's industry remarks, upcoming projects like Khosla Ka Ghosla 2 and Season 2 of Bindiya Ke Bahubali.

Bollywood is back: Karan Johar cheers for Border 2, Dhurandhar Filmmaker Karan Johar backed Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar and Sunny Deol's Border 2 on Sunday. He said the mega success of the two recent back-to-back Hindi films proves Bollywood is back.

Amber Heard explains why she doesn't want to use her voice after Johnny Depp trial Actor Amber Heard spoke about the impact of her legal battle with her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp, in the new documentary Silenced. She revealed why she no longer wants to use her voice.

Spice Girls reunion: Victoria's rare outing amid family feud. David Beckham reacts Fashion designer and singer Victoria Beckham made a rare public appearance at Emma Bunton's 50th birthday celebration in the Cotswolds on January 24. She reunited with her former Spice Girls bandmates as family tensions surrounding her eldest son, Brooklyn, remain unresolved.

This is not just my achievement: Prosenjit Chatterjee on Padam Shri Actor Prosenjit Chatterjee receives the Padma Shri at the 2026 Padma Awards. The honour recognises his four decades of versatile contributions to Bengali cinema and Indian culture.

Everyone wanted this for him: Hema Malini on Dharmendra's Padma Vibhushan Actor Dharmendra was posthumously awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 2026. His family and fans celebrate the honour while mourning his absence at the ceremony.

general news.headline: Successful India makes world stable: EU chief ahead of landmark trade dealEuropean Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's Republic Day visit came as India and Brussels push to seal a long-pending trade pact, with New Delhi signalling major tariff cuts on European car imports.

Vance, Trump stalled India trade talks: US Senator's viral audio amid tariff rowLeaked audio of Senator Ted Cruz reveals internal Trump administration rifts, with JD Vance, Peter Navarro and sometimes President Trump blamed for stalling the long-pending India-US trade deal.

Abhishek Sharma is ready for ODIs, time to unleash the Hitman heirAbhishek Sharma's explosive batting, spin bowling, and aggression against pacers give India a solid option for the ODI World Cup in South Africa
India plans to cut EU car tariffs to 40% from 110% ahead of trade deal: ReportThe anticipated tariff cuts would substantially ease access to the Indian market for Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW.

1965: When Republic Day became a morning of mourning in MadrasOn January 26, 1965, Republic Day turned to mourning in Madras as students rioted against Hindi imposition, sparking self-immolations, deaths, and a crisis that scripted India's language policy.

India will thrash you: Pakistan warned to skip T20 World Cup, save embarrassmentIndia vs New Zealand: Former India captain Kris Srikkanth jokingly urged Pakistan to skip the T20 World Cup to avoid the embarrassment of being hammered by India. The 1983 World Cup winner said most teams would be scared of facing an Indian side in belligerent batting form during the ongoing T20I series against New Zealand.

Astro Shux conferred Ashoka Chakra for daring Space Station flightThe citation highlighted exceptional courage, composure under extreme conditions, and unwavering commitment to mission success in an environment where even minor errors can prove fatal.

EU Chief stuns in fusion brocade at Republic Day paradeIn a graceful departure from her usual tailored pantsuits, Ursula von der Leyen's maroon-and-gold brocade bandhgala and off-white pants not only showcased her elegance but also reflected a deep appreciation for Indian culture.

The nihilist penguin: How a bird's lonely march captured mood of a burnt-out societyHandcrafted ByOur Editors Meet the nihilist penguin: the little bird that broke ranks, walked away from the colony, and stole the internet's heart without saying a word. In a world obsessed with productivity, connection, and "having a plan," this penguin did the unthinkable: it just left. But why has a penguin's quiet departure resonated so widely?

Live: PM Modi greets attendees as mega Republic Day parade comes to an endRepublic Day 2026 Live Updates: India is celebrating its 77th Republic Day today, with events across the country showcasing the nation's rich culture, long republican journey, military strength and security preparedness. At Kartavya Path in New Delhi, India's development story, cultural diversity and defence capabilities will be on display, including newly raised military units and mock-ups of major weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor. The celebrations will be led by President Droupadi Murmu, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in attendance, while European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will attend as chief guests. The event, themed around 150 years of Vande Mataram, will feature the Indian Army's first-ever "phased Battle Array" display, presenting drones, tanks and artillery in a realistic combat-style formation. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for live updates.

PM Modi's multi-coloured safa steals spotlight at 77th Republic Day paradeWearing a vibrant red safa, Prime Minister Narendra Modi continued his decade-old Republic Day tradition as he attended the 77th celebrations at Kartavya Path with President Droupadi Murmu and other dignitaries.

Air Force gained decisive edge during Op Sindoor, forced Pak to seek truce: StudyThe Indian Air Force established decisive air superiority over Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. This dominance forced Pakistan to seek a ceasefire, ending the conflict within four days.

One man vs 101 storey-skyscraper: Alex Honnold's heart-stopping feat. WatchAlex Honnold began his ascent up one corner of the 508-metre tower, relying on narrow L-shaped outcroppings and ornamental ledges as footholds. Unlike his usual climbs in remote wilderness, this one unfolded in the middle of a bustling city, with cheers rising from street level as he moved steadily upward.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Menopause is not that generous: Twinkle Khanna gets real about ageing at 52Twinkle Khanna shared a refreshingly honest take on menopause and ageing in her 50s. Her social media post highlighted the challenges and practical self-care steps that empower women to navigate this phase.

Bollywood is back: Karan Johar cheers for Border 2, DhurandharFilmmaker Karan Johar backed Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar and Sunny Deol's Border 2 on Sunday. He said the mega success of the two recent back-to-back Hindi films proves Bollywood is back.

Another IIT suicide, same questions: What's failing students at Kanpur?Handcrafted ByOur Editors IIT Kanpur has reported a disproportionate number of student suicides in recent years, raising urgent questions about institutional accountability, mental health systems, and academic culture. Despite task forces and guidelines, students continue to fall through cracks, exposing deep flaws in how India's elite institutes handle distress.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Indian sport has a big problem: An unsporting bureaucracyIndian sportspersons are not held back by a lack of talent or ambition, but by a bureaucracy that too often humiliates those it should protect. Until athletes are treated with dignity and governance learns accountability, Olympic ambition will remain hollow, and every medal will carry the weight of what athletes endured to win it.

Aren't you responsible for 41 deaths? AIADMK calls out Vijay's 'narcissism'AIADMK stepped up its attack on Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) founder Vijay, linking him to the Karur stampede that killed 41, and questioning his leadership and conduct.

How history turned this city into the street food capital of IndiaStreet food in India's food capital did not appear overnight. It grew with the rise and fall of empires, the movement of traders, and the daily needs of people who lived and worked in crowded markets. History shaped not only the city's streets, but also what was cooked and eaten on them.

Took Rs 3 lakh, sister's UPSC fees, ran to Goa: Teen says exams were too stressfulA 17-year-old Vadodara student fled home with Rs 3 lakh amid exam stress, sparking a multi-state police search. He was found safe in Goa and revealed he needed a break from academic pressure.

Mark Carney rules out free trade deal with China after Trump's 100% tariff threatMark Carney's comments came after Trump threatened to impose 100 per cent tariffs on Canadian goods if Ottawa followed through on a free trade deal with China. The Canadian leader reassured that recent engagement with Beijing was limited to resolving specific tariff disputes.

Bangladesh textile mills claim Indian yarn flooding market, warn of shutdownWorkers at Bangladesh textile mills have warned of a nationwide shutdown from February 1 if duty-free yarn imports, largely from India, are not withdrawn, citing huge losses, gas shortages and mill closures.

sports.headline: If Pakistan don't play T20 World Cup, broadcasters will go bankrupt: Ex cricketer Basit Ali warns Pakistan's withdrawal from the 2026 T20 World Cup could cause major losses for broadcasters. The PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi call for government clearance adds uncertainty to Pakistan's participation amid ICC's threat of sanctions.

Michael Carrick plays down permanent Manchester United job talk after Arsenal win Michael Carrick has played down talk of becoming Manchester United's permanent manager, choosing to focus on the present as United's revival gathers pace after statement wins over Arsenal and Manchester City.

India will thrash you: Pakistan warned to skip T20 World Cup, save embarrassment India vs New Zealand: Former India captain Kris Srikkanth jokingly urged Pakistan to skip the T20 World Cup to avoid the embarrassment of being hammered by India. The 1983 World Cup winner said most teams would be scared of facing an Indian side in belligerent batting form during the ongoing T20I series against New Zealand.

The Shakib card: Did Bangladesh pull a stunt to mask T20 World Cup embarrassment? The Bangladesh Cricket Board has confirmed that Shakib Al Hasan is eligible to play for the national team. But the question remains: did the BCB make this decision purely to give Shakib a platform to bow out of international cricket, or is there a different motive behind it?

Drop Sanju Samson? Ishan Kishan piles pressure on Kerala star: Ex-bowler Ishan Kishan's powerful innings puts Sanju Samson under pressure in India's T20I squad, feels former New Zealand bowler Simon Doull. The team faces a tough selection choice with Tilak Varma's return adding to the competition.

Indian sport has a big problem: An unsporting bureaucracy Indian sportspersons are not held back by a lack of talent or ambition, but by a bureaucracy that too often humiliates those it should protect. Until athletes are treated with dignity and governance learns accountability, Olympic ambition will remain hollow, and every medal will carry the weight of what athletes endured to win it.

Australian Open: Madison Keys' title defence ends after 4th round loss to Pegula Jessica Pegula ended Madison Keys' Australian Open campaign with a straight-sets win over the defending champion at the Rod Laver Arena. Pegula will next face Amanda Anisimova or Wang Xinyu in the quarter final.

Abhishek Sharma is ready for ODIs, time to unleash the Hitman heir Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting, spin bowling, and aggression against pacers give India a solid option for the ODI World Cup in South Africa

IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson told not to bat like Abhishek Sharma after hattrick of failures Ajinkya Rahane urged Sanju Samson to play his natural game amid poor form, saying he shouldn't copy Abhishek Sharma after his poor form continued during the Guwahati T20I against New Zealand on Sunday, January 25.

Supercalifragilisticfantabulous: Gavaskar speechless after India's Guwahati dominance Sunil Gavaskar was left searching for words after India's ruthless win in Guwahati, hailing a champion side as Abhishek Sharma's record knock sealed another dominant display against New Zealand.

IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Ravi Bishnoi reflects on the hard road back to India's T20I side After a testing year away from the national side, Ravi Bishnoi returned to India's T20I setup with a composed performance against New Zealand, underlining how patience, domestic grind and technical correction shaped his comeback.

Day 9 live updates: Musetti downs Fritz, Jannik Sinner in actionAustralian Open Day 9 live updates: Lorenzo Musetti and Amanda Anisimova have won their respective first sets of the fourth round fixture. Earlier, Women's Singles defending champion Madison Keys was knocked out after straight sets loss against Jessica Pegula.

Carrick-ball reigns supreme as Manchester United beat Arsenal 3-2 at Emirates stadiumCarrick-ball came of age as Manchester United stunned Arsenal 3-2 at the Emirates, with Matheus Cunha's late stunner sealing a statement win that reshaped the title race and confirmed United's revival.

Heartbreak for coach Ganguly as Pretoria Capitals lose SA20 final to SunrisersSunrisers Eastern Cape claimed their third SA20 title after defeating Pretoria Capitals in a closely contested final at Newlands, as it was heartbreak for coach Sourav Ganguly. Stubbs and Breetzke's partnership was enough to see Sunrisers over the line as Dewald Brevis' hundred went in vain.

IND vs NZ, Stat Wrap: India show no mountain is too high to climb after Guwahati epicIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I statwrap: Abhishek Sharma's explosive knock powered India to a dominant win over New Zealand, sealing the series in record-setting fashion as multiple milestones fell in one of the fastest chases in T20 history.

IS Bindra, former BCCI President, dies at 84 after prolonged illnessFormer BCCI and Punjab Cricket Association chief IS Bindra, a pioneer who helped transform Indian cricket into a billion-dollar industry, passed away at 84 on Sunday, January 25.

New-ball or death specialist? Jasprit Bumrah opens up on flexible bowling challengesIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was impressive in the third T20I against New Zealand, winning the Player of the Match award with figures of 4-0-17-3 at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati.

Yuvraj Singh pokes fun at Abhishek Sharma after missing his T20I record in GuwahatiIND vs NZ: Abhishek Sharma's blistering 13-ball fifty in Guwahati thrilled fans but left Yuvraj Singh's 12-ball T20I record intact. The former India star responded with a playful tweet, praising the youngster while reminding him who still owns the landmark.

Hardik Pandya shows elite mindset, straight back to nets after T20I series victoryIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Hardik Pandya went straight to the nets for some batting practice after India sealed the series against New Zealand with an eight-wicket win in Guwahati. Hardik had an excellent day with the ball after taking the wickets of Rachin Ravindra and Daryl Mitchell.

Padma Awards for Sports Icons: Rohit Sharma, Harmanpreet Kaur, Vijay Amritraj HonouredOn this Special Report, India Today's Harshad Ahuja discusses the prestigious Padma Awards conferred upon Indian sporting icons. Cricketers Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur are set to receive the Padma Shri, while tennis legend Vijay Amritraj will be honoured with the Padma Bhushan. Harshad Ahuja notes that 'Harmanpreet Kaur becoming the first women Indian captain to go on and end that jinx, get India that first ever World Cup' was a historic milestone achieved in Navi Mumbai. The report highlights Rohit Sharma's leadership in securing the 2024 T20 World Cup and the 2025 Champions Trophy. Furthermore, Vijay Amritraj is recognised for his pioneering role in globalising Indian tennis and his long-standing association with Wimbledon broadcasts. The discussion underscores the immense contribution of these athletes to Indian sports and their status as household names across generations.

T20 World Cup defence loading? India obliterate New Zealand to seal seriesIndia laid down a T20 World Cup marker as Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav powered an 8-wicket win over New Zealand in Guwahati.

Enough justice: Sanju Samson trolled brutally after poor form continues in 3rd T20IIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Sanju Samson scored a golden duck after Matt Henry dismissed him in the third T20I on Sunday at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati. Samson has averaged only 17 in his last 18 T20I innings.

Abhishek Sharma wreaks havoc in Guwahati, misses guru Yuvraj's record by a whiskerIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Abhishek Sharma smashed a 14-ball fifty vs New Zealand in Guwahati, falling just short of Yuvraj Singh's fastest T20I fifty record for India. On the back of his unbeaten 68-run knock, India chased down 154 to win the match by eight wickets.

Dewald Brevis hits heroic 53-ball hundred to lift Pretoria Capitals in finalDewald Brevis put on a one-man show in the SA20 final and smashed a heroic 53-ball hundred to help Pretoria Capitals post a competitive 158 for 7 against Sunrisers Eastern Cape in Cape Town.

Chakravarthy is your main bowler: Rahane slams India's Guwahati T20I playing XIAjinkya Rahane has called for Team India to avoid excessive changes to its playing XI ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup, questioning the impact of resting key players such as Varun Chakaravarthy during the ongoing series against New Zealand.

Mumbai, Bengal reach knockouts; Madhya Pradesh smash KarnatakaMumbai sealed a nine-wicket win over Hyderabad in Elite Group D to confirm their knockout berth, while Bengal cruised to an innings and 46-run bonus-point victory over Services in Elite Group C to book a quarterfinal spot.

Harshit Rana has Devon Conway's number yet again, thanks to Hardik Pandya's blinderIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Harshit Rana dismissed Devon Conway for the fifth time on the tour, with Hardik Pandya taking a stunning running catch to give India an early breakthrough in the third T20I at Guwahati.

I'm upset: Djokovic reacts to Sabalenka breaking his grand slam recordAryna Sabalenka surpassed Novak Djokovic's streak for most consecutive tiebreak wins in Grand Slams, prompting a lighthearted yet direct response from the 24-time major champion. Djokovic, who recently advanced to the Australian Open quarterfinals, reacted publicly to Sabalenka's achievement.

Aryna Sabalenka shatters Novak Djokovic's feat, Carlos Alcaraz, Coco Gauff into quartersAryna Sabalenka powered into her fourth straight Australian Open quarter-final while Coco Gauff and Carlos Alcaraz also advanced with composed performances. In contrast, Daniil Medvedev suffered a shock exit as Alcaraz set up a quarter-final clash with Alex de Minaur.

3rd T20I: Bumrah, Bishnoi return as India rest Varun Chakravarthy, ArshdeepIndia made a couple of changes as they look to wrap up the five-match T20I series against New Zealand, bringing back Jasprit Bumrah and Ravi Bishnoi for the third T20I in Guwahati on Sunday. Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy and left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh were rested as part of workload management.

Vijay Amritraj conferred Padma Bhushan; Rohit, Harmanpreet receive Padma ShriVijay Amritraj received the Padma Bhushan, while Rohit Sharma, Harmanpreet Kaur and others were awarded the Padma Shri at the Padma Awards 2026.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
